text: Bob Carlisle is an American singer and songwriter. In 1993, he had a number one song on Billboard's Christian CHR National Airplay music chart. He (and another) wrote a number one song on Billboards Country Airplay music chart (1998). ==Early life== He was born on September 29, 1956. He comes from Santa Ana, California. ==Career== He played in bands - Allies and Billy Thermal. In 1997 he had a number one album on Billboards Top Christian Albums music chart. He won a Grammy, together with Randy Thomas - Grammy Award for Best Country Song. As a songwriter he has written "Why'd You Come in Here Lookin' Like That". Dolly Parton took the song to number one on Billboards Country Airplay music chart; The song's other songwriter is Randy Thomas. ==References== Category:People from California Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Living people
title: Bob Carlisle
